JobFullDesc: Empower every person and organization on the planet to achieve more.  That’s what inspires us, drives our work and pushes us to challenge the status quo every day.  At Microsoft, we also work to empower our employees so they can achieve more.  We believe we should each find meaning in our work and ensure employees have the freedom and reach to help make a difference in the world. Are you passionate about providing a world class employee experience to Microsoft employees? Do you want to have a significant role in influencing our workplace to attract and retain the best talent?   The Microsoft Real Estate and Securities Team (RE&S) is focused enabling every person and every organization at Microsoft to achieve more through the delivery of connected, accessible, sustainable workplaces in a secure environment. The Americas portfolio includes over 5.5 Million Square Feet, 195 sites and supports over 25,000 Microsoft employees. Our team strives every day to deliver the workspaces and services that enable individuals to achieve their highest potential.   As part of the Real Estate and Securities team, this role is on a team accountable for the full life cycle of real estate activities (plan, design, build/lease, operate, and maintain) for Microsoft’s real estate portfolio of sites within the US and Canada which includes urban and suburban offices and unique specialty spaces that are home to a broad set of teams inclusive of the company’s core businesses and dynamic research & development efforts. This position has responsibility for working directly with clients within Microsoft’s Business Groups and supplier management to deliver Real Estate solutions that provide a world-class workplace experience.ResponsibilitiesSpecific responsibilities include: Working with RE&F counterparts and key suppliers to deliver complex construction projects on schedule, within approved budgets, and meeting or exceeding client expectations. Oversees the team's deployment of large-scale, campus and/or regionally-based delivery solutions while also socializing with regional leaders. Working with the construction services provider, oversee the development of program plans, schedules, and budgets for all assigned projects including resource requirements; site master planning; land development; contracting strategies; land development; infrastructure, zoning, core and shell delivery, and analysis of all operational processes relating to the delivery service and the assigned projects to recommend changes resulting in cost savings, enhanced customer service, or improved asset management.   Organizing and driving large teams of industry professionals and project support staff towards successful completion of project objectives. Providing leadership in facilitating timely decision-making and integration of key stakeholder groups and required milestones. Setting clear goals for supplier and project teams, assigning responsibilities, measuring performance against Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s) and seeking and delivering feedback to achieve quality, timely results. Developing strong client relationships with Business Group stakeholders. Become familiar with the client’s vision, business strategy and understand their rhythm of the business, organization and performance measures.   Bridge the gap with client groups in terms of construction and real estate and represent internal client’s best interest throughout design and construction. Driving action and decisions, supported by analytical rigor and data, among clients and partner stakeholders by utilizing and facilitating an awareness of business needs and priorities at multiple levels within the company. Proactively engage with clients and partners to solve problems and effectively balance specific client needs with the broader Microsoft interests and the Puget Sound portfolio. Directs and oversees the management of vendors, ensuring compliance with contracts and prior audit results. Controls vendor performance relative to cash flow and budget summaries (with cost management support). Provides direction and correction to vendors and internal support teams as needed. Coordinates with clients on tactical issues to support project business alignment with internal teams (e.g., Real Estate and Facilities regions, Procurement, Security, Center of Innovation (COI), Global Shared Services (GSS), Information Technology, CELA, Project Engineering, Business Risk Management, etc.). Accountability for RE&F commitments to the business. Partners with Global Shared Services, Legal, and Procurement as required to ensures vendors have relevant contracts. Reviews documents and makes recommendations for negotiations (e.g., finances, business term) and executes low to medium business impact contracts (e.g., land or building acquisition, leases, incentives).  Manages the preparation of Request for Proposals (RFPs), Project Expenditure Requests (PERs), and other project approval tools and templates. Identifies and directs vendor scope of work, design review of site and building plans, change orders, and invoices. Oversees the creation and application of best practices for identifying and driving cost-effective solutions for the strategic and tactical delivery of a construction project. Develops, manages, and reports on scope, schedule, and budget of project. Oversees and implements project controls in work activities (e.g., Project Expenditure Requests (PERs), purchase orders, change orders, and pay applications). OtherEmbody our culture and values QualificationsRequired/Minimum Qualifications5+ years portfolio management, real estate, or office management experienceOR Bachelor's Degree or degree equivalent in Business Management, Real Estate, Project Management, or related field AND 3+ years portfolio management, real estate, or office management experienceOR equivalent experience. Additional or Preferred Qualifications7+ years portfolio management, real estate, or office management experienceOR Bachelor's Degree or degree equivalent in Business Management, Real Estate, Project Management, or related field AND 5+ years portfolio management, real estate, or office management experience OR equivalent experienceDeep knowledge and passion for architecture and construction preferred.Experience with a variety of project types ranging from small tenant improvements to full building interior renovations preferred.Knowledge of building systems and processes preferred.Ability to understand the development and interpretation of architectural designs and drawings preferred.Scope, schedule, and budget control techniques experience preferred.Knowledge of industry standard construction procurement and contracting methodologies, with the ability to drive contracting processes preferred.Experience and ability to engage and manage local jurisdictions and public agencies as requiredThis position requires significant experience (10+ years) with land/site development projects with at least 5 years as a project management experience preferred. PMP certification preferred. The desired individual should have extensive operations, project, contract, budget/financial management experience and a strong interest in delivering innovative, new workplace solutions.  This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by an employee within this position.
